II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC agrees that it shall not use the Equipment referred to in 2.8 below for the production, at its Buena Park, California facility, of any competitive energy drinks without Purchaser's prior written approval; provided however that if Purchaser fails to purchase _______ cases of Products with a tolerance of 20% i.e., a minimum of _______ cases, per year from 7UP/RC during the term of this Agreement, 7UP/RC shall thereafter be entitled to use the Equipment for the production of other energy drinks provided that in such event 7UP/RC shall be obliged to make payment to the Purchaser of an agreed royalty fee in respect of such other energy drinks on a per case basis until the Purchaser is reimbursed for the costs incurred by it to purchase the Equipment concerned.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Prior to the beginning of each calendar quarter, Purchaser shall provide to 7UP/RC a written forecast of the number of cases of Product by flavor and package size expected to be ordered in the following three (3) month period.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Based on the forecast, 7UP/RC shall purchase raw materials (sodium citrate, citric acid), in amounts, in 7UP/RC's reasonable opinion, are required to fill orders during such period.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
All other raw materials shall be supplied by Purchaser at its expense including the expense of delivering raw materials to 7UP/RC's facility for production of Product.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall be financially responsible for all outofdate Product and raw materials.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall fax a purchase order for Product to 7UP/RC at least ten (10) business days prior to the expected delivery date.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
The terms and conditions contained in any order form issued by Purchaser under this Agreement shall be null and void and entirely surpassed by the terms and conditions of this Agreement except for those terms proposed by Purchaser and specifically accepted by 7UP/RC.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall notify 7UP/RC in writing of any claim relating to damaged, defective or nonconforming Product or any shortage in quantity of any shipment of Product.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
In the event such rejection or shortage is due to 7UP/RC fault, error or neglect, 7UP/RC shall replace the rejected Product or make up the shortage in the next production run following receipt of such notice at no cost to Purchaser and shall make arrangements with Purchaser for the disposition of any rejected Product.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall assume title and risk of loss for Product ordered upon delivery of Product to transport.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall charge Purchaser and Purchaser shall pay for Product as specified in Exhibit A, unless 7UP/RC and Purchaser agree in writing to a different price.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall invoice Purchaser for each shipment of Product and Purchaser shall receive a 2% discount to the extent such invoice is paid within ten (10) days from the invoice date with all amounts due within thirty (30) days of the invoice date.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
At any time during the term of this Agreement, 7UP/RC may pass through and otherwise charge Purchaser for any cost increases for raw materials, labor or as a result of changes in specifications.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Further, if any law or regulation is enacted or imposed anywhere, the effect of which is to impose upon or to cause 7UP/RC to incur any cost or expense (which did not exist on the date of this Agreement) with respect to container deposits, used or empty container collection, container recycling or disposal, beverage or package labeling requirements, any tax or duty in the nature of an excise tax or otherwise, upon or with respect to Product or the performance of 7UP/RC services, 7UP/RC shall be entitled to increase the price of Product by an amount sufficient and in such manner and to such extent that none of the burden of such costs or expenses is borne by 7UP/RC.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall also be responsible for all property taxes on the equipment.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC agrees not to use the Equipment for the production, at its Buena Park, California facility, of any other energy drink reasonably similar to Product without Purchaser's prior written approval.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
At the end of the term of this Agreement, 7UP/RC may use the Equipment to produce Products as well as other energy drinks.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
This Agreement will commence on April 1, 2003 and shall continue until March 31, 2008 unless sooner terminated pursuant to paragraph 3.2 herein.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
This Agreement may be terminated prior to the end of its term (i) upon written notice by either party to the other party in the event that the other party breaches any material provision of this Agreement and fails to remedy the breach prior to expiration of the thirty (30) day period or (ii) following notice by either party to the other upon the insolvency or bankruptcy of the other party.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall acquire and store, at its sole cost and expense, the raw materials identified in Section 2.2 herein to meet the quarterly forecast.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall reimburse 7UP/RC for any finished Product and Branded Materials which remain in 7UP/RC possession following the termination of this Agreement or a change in Specifications or other decisions of Purchaser which render such Branded Materials obsolete or not useable by 7UP/RC.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall ship Product using pallets and a pallet pattern reflected in Exhibit A. Pallets shall be exchanged upon delivery of Product or purchased by Purchaser of 7UP/RC standard cost if pallets are not exchanged.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
To the extent requested by Purchaser, Product shall be shipped to Purchaser in plastic shells.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Purchaser shall pay 7UP/RC a deposit equal to 7UP/RC standard rate which shall be refunded to Purchaser when the shells are returned.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall test or cause to be tested each batch of Product purchased pursuant to this Agreement before delivery to Purchaser.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Such testing shall be conducted according to 7UP/RC established practice and procedures, which Purchaser has reviewed and deemed suitable.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
While manufacturing, bottling, canning, labeling, packaging and storing Product, 7UP/RC shall conform strictly with the formula, methods of manufacture, standards of quality and sanitation, bottling, canning, labeling, package design and packaging instructions and other specifications and instructions which Purchaser shall furnish from time to time.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
VII WARRANTIES 7.1 Compliance with the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
7UP/RC warrants that all Product delivered to Purchaser pursuant to this Agreement will at the time of such delivery not be adulterated or misbranded within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, as amended, ("Act") or within the meaning of any applicable state or municipal law in which the definitions of adulteration and misbranding are substantially the same as that contained in the Act, as such Act and such laws are constituted and effective at the time of delivery and will not be an article which may not, under the provisions of such Act, be introduced into interstate commerce.

7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.

II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.

Each party hereto shall not disclose any confidential information received by it pursuant to this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
This obligation shall not apply to: (a) information which is known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure and documented by written records made prior to the date of this Agreement; (b) information disclosed to the receiving party by a third party who has a right to make such disclosure; (c) information which becomes patented, published or otherwise part of the public domain or information from a third person obtaining such information as a matter of right.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.

Purchaser will indemnify and hold 7UP/RC harmless against any and all liability, damages, losses, costs or expenses resulting from any third party claims made or suits brought against 7UP/RC which arise out of the promotion, storage, handling, distribution, sale of Product by Purchaser, from Purchaser's negligence or from the negligence of Purchaser's officers, agents or employees.

II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
The obligations of the indemnifying party under this Article XI are conditioned upon the written notice to the indemnifying party with regard to a claim or lawsuit which is alleged to be covered within fifteen (15) days after the indemnified party has received notice of said claim or lawsuit.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
The above indemnities are further conditioned upon the cooperation of the indemnified party with the indemnifying party in any regard in the investigation and defense of any claim or lawsuit alleged to be covered by the above indemnities.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Any indemnity shall be void as to any claim or legal action for which settlement or any offer of settlement is made without the prior written consent of the indemnifying party.

XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Judgment upon any award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.
II PURCHASE AND SALE OF PRODUCTS 2.1 Obligations of Parties.
Any notices permitted or required by this Agreement shall be sent by telex, telecopy, registered mail or other recognized private mail carrier service and shall be effective when received if sent and addressed as follows or to such other address as may be designated by a party in writing: If to Purchaser: Hansens Beverage Company 1010 Railroad St Corona, Ca 92882 Attention: Rodney Sacks Copy to: Hilton Schlosberg If to 7UP/RC: 3220 East 26th St. Los Angeles, CA 90023 Attention: Steve Walb Copy to: Mike Nelson, Esq.

Purchaser shall purchase Products from 7UP/RC from time to time on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement, during the Term of this Agreement.

Purchaser shall purchase Products from 7UP/RC from time to time on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement, during the Term of this Agreement.

Purchaser shall purchase Products from 7UP/RC from time to time on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement, during the Term of this Agreement.
7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.

Purchaser shall purchase Products from 7UP/RC from time to time on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement, during the Term of this Agreement.

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
Purchaser shall be financially responsible for all outofdate Product and raw materials.

Purchaser shall be financially responsible for all outofdate Product and raw materials.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
Purchaser shall be financially responsible for all outofdate Product and raw materials.

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.

For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.

Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.

Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.

4329 TriBlender TriClover machine together with two 328 Waukesha transfer pumps with 10 h.p.

("New Equipment") and assume financial responsibility for the installation and wiring thereof, in accordance with the estimate from BEECO which is attached hereto as Exhibit C. Purchaser shall also be financially responsible for all taxes and freight in connection with the New Equipment.
Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.

Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.

Product will be scheduled for production by 7UP/RC at the earliest possible date.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
At any time during the term of this Agreement, 7UP/RC may pass through and otherwise charge Purchaser for any cost increases for raw materials, labor or as a result of changes in specifications.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
Further, if any law or regulation is enacted or imposed anywhere, the effect of which is to impose upon or to cause 7UP/RC to incur any cost or expense (which did not exist on the date of this Agreement) with respect to container deposits, used or empty container collection, container recycling or disposal, beverage or package labeling requirements, any tax or duty in the nature of an excise tax or otherwise, upon or with respect to Product or the performance of 7UP/RC services, 7UP/RC shall be entitled to increase the price of Product by an amount sufficient and in such manner and to such extent that none of the burden of such costs or expenses is borne by 7UP/RC.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
Purchaser shall also be responsible for all property taxes on the equipment.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
7UP/RC agrees not to use the Equipment for the production, at its Buena Park, California facility, of any other energy drink reasonably similar to Product without Purchaser's prior written approval.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
VII WARRANTIES 7.1 Compliance with the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
7UP/RC warrants that all Product delivered to Purchaser pursuant to this Agreement will at the time of such delivery not be adulterated or misbranded within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, as amended, ("Act") or within the meaning of any applicable state or municipal law in which the definitions of adulteration and misbranding are substantially the same as that contained in the Act, as such Act and such laws are constituted and effective at the time of delivery and will not be an article which may not, under the provisions of such Act, be introduced into interstate commerce.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
This obligation shall not apply to: (a) information which is known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure and documented by written records made prior to the date of this Agreement; (b) information disclosed to the receiving party by a third party who has a right to make such disclosure; (c) information which becomes patented, published or otherwise part of the public domain or information from a third person obtaining such information as a matter of right.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

All orders shall be for full truckload quantities of Product.

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.

Purchaser shall assume title and risk of loss for Product ordered upon delivery of Product to transport.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
Purchaser shall assume title and risk of loss for Product ordered upon delivery of Product to transport.

Purchaser shall assume title and risk of loss for Product ordered upon delivery of Product to transport.

7UP/RC warrants that all Product delivered to Purchaser pursuant to this Agreement will at the time of such delivery not be adulterated or misbranded within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, as amended, ("Act") or within the meaning of any applicable state or municipal law in which the definitions of adulteration and misbranding are substantially the same as that contained in the Act, as such Act and such laws are constituted and effective at the time of delivery and will not be an article which may not, under the provisions of such Act, be introduced into interstate commerce.

VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.

Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.
This obligation shall not apply to: (a) information which is known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure and documented by written records made prior to the date of this Agreement; (b) information disclosed to the receiving party by a third party who has a right to make such disclosure; (c) information which becomes patented, published or otherwise part of the public domain or information from a third person obtaining such information as a matter of right.
Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.

("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").

Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.

Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.

Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.

Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.

Such prices shall be fixed during the term of this Agreement except as provided by Paragraph 2.7 below.

VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.

XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.

("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
Further, if any law or regulation is enacted or imposed anywhere, the effect of which is to impose upon or to cause 7UP/RC to incur any cost or expense (which did not exist on the date of this Agreement) with respect to container deposits, used or empty container collection, container recycling or disposal, beverage or package labeling requirements, any tax or duty in the nature of an excise tax or otherwise, upon or with respect to Product or the performance of 7UP/RC services, 7UP/RC shall be entitled to increase the price of Product by an amount sufficient and in such manner and to such extent that none of the burden of such costs or expenses is borne by 7UP/RC.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
Further, if any law or regulation is enacted or imposed anywhere, the effect of which is to impose upon or to cause 7UP/RC to incur any cost or expense (which did not exist on the date of this Agreement) with respect to container deposits, used or empty container collection, container recycling or disposal, beverage or package labeling requirements, any tax or duty in the nature of an excise tax or otherwise, upon or with respect to Product or the performance of 7UP/RC services, 7UP/RC shall be entitled to increase the price of Product by an amount sufficient and in such manner and to such extent that none of the burden of such costs or expenses is borne by 7UP/RC.

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.

If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed under the laws of the State of New York, U.S.A. 13.6 Severability.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.
In the event that any term or provision of this Agreement shall violate any applicable statute, ordinance or rule of law in any jurisdiction in which it is used, such provision shall be ineffective to the extent of such violation without invalidating any other provision hereof.
If requested by Purchaser, 7UP/RC shall provide Purchaser with suitable evidence establishing that a cost increase did occur.

("New Equipment") and assume financial responsibility for the installation and wiring thereof, in accordance with the estimate from BEECO which is attached hereto as Exhibit C. Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.

Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.

Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.

VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.

XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
Judgment upon any award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.
Purchaser shall purchase the equipment specified in Exhibit B (the "Equipment') at its sole cost and expense.

XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
Judgment upon any award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.

All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
No course of dealing or usage of trade shall be used to modify the terms and conditions herein.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
No waiver by either party of any default shall be effective unless in writing, nor shall any such waiver operate as a waiver of any other default or of the same default on a future occasion.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.
This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the successors or permitted assigns of each of the parties and may not be assigned or transferred by either party without the prior written consent of the other.
All payments for the Equipment shall be made by Purchaser directly to the Equipment supplier.

("New Equipment") and assume financial responsibility for the installation and wiring thereof, in accordance with the estimate from BEECO which is attached hereto as Exhibit C. Purchaser shall also be responsible for all property taxes on the equipment.

7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
This Agreement may be terminated prior to the end of its term (i) upon written notice by either party to the other party in the event that the other party breaches any material provision of this Agreement and fails to remedy the breach prior to expiration of the thirty (30) day period or (ii) following notice by either party to the other upon the insolvency or bankruptcy of the other party.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
7UP/RC shall acquire and store, at its sole cost and expense, the raw materials identified in Section 2.2 herein to meet the quarterly forecast.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
7UP/RC shall ship Product using pallets and a pallet pattern reflected in Exhibit A. Pallets shall be exchanged upon delivery of Product or purchased by Purchaser of 7UP/RC standard cost if pallets are not exchanged.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
To the extent requested by Purchaser, Product shall be shipped to Purchaser in plastic shells.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
Purchaser shall pay 7UP/RC a deposit equal to 7UP/RC standard rate which shall be refunded to Purchaser when the shells are returned.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
7UP/RC shall test or cause to be tested each batch of Product purchased pursuant to this Agreement before delivery to Purchaser.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
Such testing shall be conducted according to 7UP/RC established practice and procedures, which Purchaser has reviewed and deemed suitable.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
While manufacturing, bottling, canning, labeling, packaging and storing Product, 7UP/RC shall conform strictly with the formula, methods of manufacture, standards of quality and sanitation, bottling, canning, labeling, package design and packaging instructions and other specifications and instructions which Purchaser shall furnish from time to time.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Purchaser shall be responsible for the actual cost of the Equipment.

Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
Purchaser shall also be responsible for all property taxes on the equipment.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
Purchaser shall also be responsible for all property taxes on the equipment.

Purchaser shall also be responsible for all property taxes on the equipment.

7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.

7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
Such testing shall be conducted according to 7UP/RC established practice and procedures, which Purchaser has reviewed and deemed suitable.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
While manufacturing, bottling, canning, labeling, packaging and storing Product, 7UP/RC shall conform strictly with the formula, methods of manufacture, standards of quality and sanitation, bottling, canning, labeling, package design and packaging instructions and other specifications and instructions which Purchaser shall furnish from time to time.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.

7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.

7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.

7UP/RC shall perform routine maintenance on the Equipment and shall be financially responsible for minor repairs.

7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
In the event that such recall results from any cause or event arising from defective manufacture of the Product by 7UP/RC, 7UP/RC shall be responsible for all expenses of the recall.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
VII WARRANTIES 7.1 Compliance with the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
7UP/RC warrants that all Product delivered to Purchaser pursuant to this Agreement will at the time of such delivery not be adulterated or misbranded within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, as amended, ("Act") or within the meaning of any applicable state or municipal law in which the definitions of adulteration and misbranding are substantially the same as that contained in the Act, as such Act and such laws are constituted and effective at the time of delivery and will not be an article which may not, under the provisions of such Act, be introduced into interstate commerce.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
7UP/RC warrants that Product sold and delivered pursuant to this Agreement will conform when delivered to the Specifications.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.

Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.

Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
This obligation shall not apply to: (a) information which is known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure and documented by written records made prior to the date of this Agreement; (b) information disclosed to the receiving party by a third party who has a right to make such disclosure; (c) information which becomes patented, published or otherwise part of the public domain or information from a third person obtaining such information as a matter of right.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.

Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.

Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.

Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
Judgment upon any award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.
Should this Agreement terminate early, 7UP/RC shall have the right but not the obligation to purchase the Equipment at the fair value thereof at that time.

("New Equipment") and assume financial responsibility for the installation and wiring thereof, in accordance with the estimate from BEECO which is attached hereto as Exhibit C. To the extent requested by Purchaser, Product shall be shipped to Purchaser in plastic shells.

To the extent requested by Purchaser, Product shall be shipped to Purchaser in plastic shells.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").

7UP/RC shall also: (a) maintain and operate its bottling and canning plants at all times in good and sanitary operating order, condition and repair and in compliance with any standards required by applicable law, with sufficient production and storage capacity to fully and faithfully to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) date and production code each production run of the Product by a legible means to identify at least the date when and the packing such Product were produced, and keep Purchaser fully apprised of the coding systems used and all changes therein; and (c) package all Product in accordance with manufacturing standards (if any) specified by Purchaser and to such standards as are required by applicable law.

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
Purchaser shall pay 7UP/RC a deposit equal to 7UP/RC standard rate which shall be refunded to Purchaser when the shells are returned.

Purchaser shall pay 7UP/RC a deposit equal to 7UP/RC standard rate which shall be refunded to Purchaser when the shells are returned.
For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.
Purchaser shall pay 7UP/RC a deposit equal to 7UP/RC standard rate which shall be refunded to Purchaser when the shells are returned.

For the purposes of this Agreement, the expenses of recall shall include, without limitation, the expenses of notification and destruction or return of the recalled Product and Purchaser's cost for Product recalled but not the expense or service fee associated with sales representatives' or management's time which shall be borne by Purchaser.

VII WARRANTIES 7.1 Compliance with the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
7UP/RC warrants that all Product delivered to Purchaser pursuant to this Agreement will at the time of such delivery not be adulterated or misbranded within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, as amended, ("Act") or within the meaning of any applicable state or municipal law in which the definitions of adulteration and misbranding are substantially the same as that contained in the Act, as such Act and such laws are constituted and effective at the time of delivery and will not be an article which may not, under the provisions of such Act, be introduced into interstate commerce.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.

VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.

("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.

VIPRODUCT RECALLS In the event (a) any government authority issues a request, directive or order that Product be recalled, or (b) a court of competent jurisdiction orders such a recall, or (c) 7UP/RC reasonably determines after consultation with Purchaser that Product should be recalled, the parties shall take all appropriate corrective actions.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.

VII WARRANTIES 7.1 Compliance with the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.

VII WARRANTIES 7.1 Compliance with the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.

VIII FORCE MAJEURE Failure of either party to perform its obligations under this Agreement (except the obligation to make payments) shall not subject such party to any liability to the other if such failure is caused by acts such as, but not limited to, acts of God, fire, explosion, flood, drought, war, riot, sabotage, embargo, strikes or other labor trouble, failure in whole or in part of suppliers to deliver on schedule materials, equipment or machinery, interruption of or delay in transportation, compliance with any order or regulation of any government entity acting with color of right or by any other cause beyond the reasonable control of the parties.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
IX CONFIDENTIALITY 7Up/ RC shall not be liable for indirect, special, incidental, consequential or penal damages, based on or attributable to the formulation of Product, but this limitation shall not apply to or have any effect in respect of any damages based on or attributable to any defects in the manufacture of Product or the packaging thereof.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Each party hereto shall not disclose any confidential information received by it pursuant to this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
This obligation shall not apply to: (a) information which is known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure and documented by written records made prior to the date of this Agreement; (b) information disclosed to the receiving party by a third party who has a right to make such disclosure; (c) information which becomes patented, published or otherwise part of the public domain or information from a third person obtaining such information as a matter of right.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Nothing contained in this Article shall be construed to restrict Purchaser or 7UP/RC from disclosing confidential information as required: (a) for regulatory, tax, customs or other governmental reasons; (b) for audit purposes; (c) by court order; (d) from using such confidential information as is reasonably necessary to perform acts permitted by this Agreement.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Purchaser will indemnify and hold 7UP/RC harmless against any and all liability, damages, losses, costs or expenses resulting from any third party claims made or suits brought against 7UP/RC which arise out of the promotion, storage, handling, distribution, sale of Product by Purchaser, from Purchaser's negligence or from the negligence of Purchaser's officers, agents or employees.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
7UP/RC will indemnify and hold Purchaser harmless against any and all liability, damages, costs or expenses resulting from any third party claims made or suits brought against Purchaser which arise out of the manufacture of Product by 7UP/RC, from 7UP/RC negligence or from the negligence of 7UP/RC's officers, agents or employees.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
The obligations of the indemnifying party under this Article XI are conditioned upon the written notice to the indemnifying party with regard to a claim or lawsuit which is alleged to be covered within fifteen (15) days after the indemnified party has received notice of said claim or lawsuit.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
The above indemnities are further conditioned upon the cooperation of the indemnified party with the indemnifying party in any regard in the investigation and defense of any claim or lawsuit alleged to be covered by the above indemnities.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Any indemnity shall be void as to any claim or legal action for which settlement or any offer of settlement is made without the prior written consent of the indemnifying party.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Judgment upon any award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.
Any notices permitted or required by this Agreement shall be sent by telex, telecopy, registered mail or other recognized private mail carrier service and shall be effective when received if sent and addressed as follows or to such other address as may be designated by a party in writing: If to Purchaser: Hansens Beverage Company 1010 Railroad St Corona, Ca 92882 Attention: Rodney Sacks Copy to: Hilton Schlosberg If to 7UP/RC: 3220 East 26th St. Los Angeles, CA 90023 Attention: Steve Walb Copy to: Mike Nelson, Esq.

No course of dealing or usage of trade shall be used to modify the terms and conditions herein.
7.2 Conformity with Specifications.

XII ARBITRATION Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach or termination hereof shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted by JAMS/Endispute.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
("JAMS") in accordance with JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures (the "Rules").
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
The arbitration shall be heard by one arbitrator to be selected in accordance with the Rules, in Orange County, California.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
Judgment upon any award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
Within seven (7) calendar days after appointment the arbitrator shall set the hearing date, which shall be within 90 days after the filing date of the demand for arbitration unless a later date is required for good cause shown and shall order a mutual exchange of what he/she determines to be relevant documents and the dates thereafter for the taking of up to a maximum of 5 depositions by each party to last no more than 2 days in aggregate for each party.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
In addition to all other relief, the arbitrator shall have the power to award reasonable attorneys' fees to the prevailing party.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
The arbitrator shall make his or her award no later than 7 calendar days after the close of evidence or the submission of final briefs, whichever occurs later.
This obligation will continue for a period of three (3) years after termination of this Agreement or any extension thereof.
